intro: Raulinoa echinata, commonly known as the spiny raulinoa, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stem and distinctive spiny leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Raulinoa echinata is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest for botanists and horticulturists alike.
